column1: Iwasuki Ward is within the Kantō Plain
column2: in the northeast portion of Saitama City.

column1: Iwatsuki developed from the Muromachi period as a castle town next to Iwatsuki Castle and the center of Iwatsuki Domain under the Edo period Tokugawa shogunate. It was also a post town on the Nikkō Onari Kaidō connecting Edo with Nikko.
The modern town of Iwatsuki created within Minamisaitama District
column2: Saitama with the establishment of the municipalities system on April 1
column4: 1954 Iwatsuki merged with the neighboring villages of Niiwa
column8: Kawai and Jionji and was elevated to city status on July 1 1954. On April 1
column9: 2005 Iwatsuki merged with the city of Saitama
column10: becoming Iwatsuki Ward. Iwatsuki is known as the "City of Dolls" (人形のまち Ningyō no Machi) due to a history of doll-making that dates back to the 17th century.
